intro: Selago hyssopifolia subsp. retrotricha, commonly known as the roughleaf selago, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or violet, arranged in whorls along the stem. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands or shrublands. Due to its ornamental value and resilience, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
